subject: Art & Design
title: Haute Couture: The Birth of Fashion Design
description: A quick win: understand Haute Couture: The Birth of Fashion Design.

hook.text: Charles Frederick Worth sewed his name into garments in the 1850s. Before him, dressmakers were anonymous.

buildup.text: Haute couture means 'high sewing' â€” custom-fitted garments made by hand in Paris ateliers.

discovery.text: Worth created seasonal collections, fashion shows, and the idea that a designer â€” not the client â€” dictates the design.

twist.text: Today, fewer than 15 houses officially qualify as haute couture. It's legally protected in France. Rules are strict.

climax.text: Couture loses money. But it builds brand prestige that sells millions in perfume, bags, and ready-to-wear.

punchline.text: Haute couture isn't about selling dresses. It's about selling dreams.

quiz.question: Why is haute couture important for fashion houses despite losing money?
options: It builds prestige that drives sales of perfume, accessories, and ready-to-wear
It satisfies legal requirements in France
It trains new designers for the industry
